attributes.action: A referendum on whether to allow Scotland to remain or be expelled from the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK subsidizes Scottish tax spending. Fiscal studies show that Scotland’s fiscal deficit has risen to nearly £2,000 per person after the gap between tax income and spending widened to become more than three times larger than the UK as a whole.

The SNP has treated UK politics with contempt in pursuit of its own independence agenda with attempts to derail Brexit negotiations & undermine trade talks. The rest of the UK should be allowed to vote on allowing Scotland to remain part of the union.
attributes.background: This petition requires a binding referendum allowing all residents of the UK to vote on Scottish independence allowing Scotland to remain within the union; or expelling Scotland from the UK (without a ‘divorce’ settlement) allowing Scottish independence (both legally and financially).

rejection.details:

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to leave the Union would be a matter for the people of Scotland based on their consent, rather than by a decision of the people of the other nations of the UK.
